isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - WINDSHIELD AND WEATHER SEAL

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 4 for Items in parentheses.

The windshield is a two-piece construction (Item 2). A one-piece molded weather seal (weather strip) (Item 1) fits around the edge of both windshield halves and secures the glass to the windshield opening.
A center divider bar/weather seal (Item 3) seals the inner edges of the windshield.

note.para: When replacing the windshield, ALWAYS install a new weather seal. A used weather seal is likely to be stretched or deteriorated; do not re-use a windshield seal.

svcsubproc.title: Remove

step1.para:
Before removing the windshield, it will be necessary to remove the windshield wiper arms and blades; refer to WIPER ARM, Remove, Electric
or Air
.
Remove the windshield center divider bar and weather seal (Item 3) as follows.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 5 for Items in parentheses.

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. WELD STUD (SHOWN) OR PAN HEAD SCREW

step1.para: Remove the three acorn nuts (Item 7) from the weld studs or pan head screws (Item 3) on the inner center divider bar (Item 6). Remove the inner and outer center divider bars and seals (Items 1, 2, 5 and 6).
If the windshield is not damaged and it is desired to replace the weather seal only, it is advisable to first cut away the portion of the seal which is molded around the flange of the cab.
Cutting away the windshield weather seal will allow easier removal of the windshield and lessen the possibility of breaking or cracking the glass being removed.

svcsubproc.para:
If the unit is equipped with an exterior sun shade, refer to SUN SHADE, Remove
for 5000 or 9000 series as required.
Refer to Figure 6 for all Items in parentheses.

figure.caption: Figure 6. Windshield Inner Center Divider Bar

svcsubproc.para: If the unit is equipped with an air deflector, the inside center divider bar (Item 1) is also attached to the header and cowl. Remove the two mounting bolts and washers (Item 6) in the header and two screws, lockwashers and nuts (Item 3) in the cowl. Remove the inner and outer center divider bars and weather seals, being careful not to damage the seals.

svcsubproc.title: Install
svcsubproc.para: The flange at the windshield opening must be cleaned of all old sealing compound or dirt before installing a new weather seal and windshield.

note.para: For the windshield, use only laminated safety glass (A.S.A. Z26.1 - 1950 Item 1).

step1.para: Install the new weather seal ( Item 1, Figure 7) around the perimeter of the flange in the windshield opening ( Item 2, Figure 7).

note.para: During installation, be sure the vulcanized weather seal joint is located at the top center of the windshield opening (at the top of the center divider bar).

step1.para: Apply a soapy solution to the glass channels in the weather seal to ease windshield installation.

Starting in the center, be sure the writing on the windshield is at the bottom, then slide the driver side (left) windshield ( Item 2, Figure 8) into the weather seal ( Item 1, Figure 8) channel until it is fully seated at the top and bottom.

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. PUSH GLASS IN DIRECTION OF ARROW

note.para: Wait until both windshield halves are in place to complete seating at the outside of the glass.

step1.para: Apply more soapy solution to the glass channel for the passenger side (right) windshield in the weather seal ( Item 1, Figure 9) again, if required. Starting in the center, be sure the writing on the windshield is at the bottom, then slide the passenger side (right) windshield ( Item 2, Figure 9) into the weather seal channel until it is fully seated at the top and bottom.

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. PUSH GLASS IN DIRECTION OF ARROW

step1.para: Using tools similar to those shown in Figure 10, finish seating the windshield as follows:

step2.para: Carefully insert the wedge ( Item 1, Figure 11) between the two windshield halves.

figure.caption: Figure 11. Seat Seal on Outside of Glass

step2.para: While holding the wedge ( Item 1, Figure 11) in place, run the pointed end of the weather seal tool ( Item 2, Figure 11) under the edge of the weather seal and pull the tool around the perimeter of the glass to seat the seal on the outside of the glass.

step1.para: After the windshield halves are seated in the weather seal ( Item 1, Figure 12), insert the curved end of the weather seal tool ( Item 2, Figure 12) into the seal so that it catches the inner seal. Pull, and work all the way around the seal to fully seat the lip.

note.para: Do not overseal the lips ( Figure 12 and Figure 13). If lips are oversealed, run weather seal tool over area again. Overseal is the condition in which the outer lip has been pushed inward past the sealing groove in the inner lip.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 14 for Items in parentheses.

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. WELD STUD (SHOWN) OR PAN HEAD SCREW
8. RAISED PORTION OF INNER AND OUTER SEALS

step1.para: Install outer center divider bar seal (Item 2) over the 3 weld studs or pan head screws of the outer center divider bar (Item 1). Then install the outer center divider bar and seal on the windshield, making sure the raised portion of the seal is installed between the two windshield halves (Item 4).

While holding the outer center divider bar and seal ( Item 1, Figure 15) in position, have an assistant install the inner center divider bar seal ( Item 2, Figure 15) and inner center divider bar ( Items 5 and 6, Figure 14) over the 3 weld studs or pan head screws of the outer center divider bar and make sure the raised portion (Item 8) of the inner center divider bar seal is installed between the two windshield halves.

figure.caption: Figure 15. Install Inner Center Divider Bar Seal

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. OUTER CENTER DIVIDER BAR AND SEAL

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 16 for Items in parentheses.

figure.caption: Figure 16. Install Center Divider Bar Acorn Nuts

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. WELD STUD OR PAN HEAD SCREW

step1.para: For 9000 series, install the center divider bar acorn nuts (Item 2) on the three weld studs (Item 1) and tighten the nuts to 60 in-lbs. (6.7 Nm).
For 5000 series, install the center divider bar acorn nuts (Item 2) on the three pan head screws (Item 1) and tighten the nuts to 60 in-lbs. (6.7 Nm).

caution.para: Do not over-tighten the center divider bar acorn nuts. You may crack the windshield because the windshield halves are positioned at an angle.

step1.para:
If the unit is equipped with an exterior sun shade, refer to SUN SHADE, Install
for 5000 and 9000 series as required.

If the unit is equipped with an air deflector, the inside center divider bar ( Item 1, Figure 17) must be the proper inner center divider bar and attached to the header and cowl with the proper mounting hardware after the acorn nuts are tightened.

note.para: Make sure the mounting hardware is tight and the threads are not stripped. If not, it may cause progressive damage to roof and/or header panels.

step1.para:
Install the wiper arms and blades. Refer to WIPER ARM, Install, Electric
or Air
.
